text:
Hey Guys - I have a question regarding API

We wan to take the API:

"var ACCESS_TOKEN = "pat-eu1-...";"

and we send that back through this

"fetch(`<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/email/${email}/profile>`, {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Authorization": `Bearer ${ACCESS_TOKEN}`"

> My question here is this: in Documentations there is no "pat-eu1-" in front of the API Key. Does my colleague gave me a wrong one here? Or can I use this + the string of numbers & letters?
Thanks, that helped!
Thank you for your reply <@U25PYL3Q8>
Hi Nicholas, thanks for the reply. Ended up using another approach instead :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi, We  installed  salesforce app in HubSpot. all the updates to contacts in salesforce are flowing to HubSpot.  This integration was done long back. Now we are not sure if this integration is using our HubSpot API key.  can someone tell me how I can  replace the API key with private app access key  for the salesforce connecte app ?
Can we create the access token (<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/get-access-and-refresh-tokens>) using API in serverless-functions ?
of course
that token is correct, and you can use it, but they docs are talking about hapikeys and that's a private app not a hapikey so they will look different

Hello, trying to create an association or deal between `Contacts`  &  `Products`  through API.
Is it possible?
Hi
I am trying to connect with custom contact properties
but its giving me error'
con not find value
what could be the issue?
Yes you can associate deals with line items (which are just like products) but you can't associate contacts with products, what's the usecase?
Which api are you using?
what does your request look like?
what is the custom property? how was that setup? do you have a value for it?
No that's more for marketplace apps you can create private apps through the HubSpot UI: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>
I’ve imported whole base of contacts and products from app to HubSpot with auto sync and marketing wants to identify customers according to products they bought.. so I need this kind of association..
I guess i can handle with it, but it’s not like a join table so it takes some times to filter columns

Yeah it's something that the HubSpot team is thinking about but not currently a thing they support: you can build some hacking solutions to do the same thing (custom properties, custom objects, workflows that keep the info insync) but hopefully in the future it will be fulling supported
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Associate-products-show-product-associations-on-Company-Contact/idi-p/321592>
I have mentioned properties and URL also from where I am testing
I am assuming wither I am testing on wrong URL or I am missing some settings
Do you want to go to the HubSpot properties setting in the ui and click </> to find the internal name for the properties
I think you just have the names for the properties wrong
also it looks like one of them might be a dropdown is that on purpose?
oh man
this solved my issue
thanks !!
Love you
of course bro
no problem
:heart:

whether you can modify the HS domain header or not isn’t really the issue here (you can’t, there is no way to modify HS headers)

the PDP.BOX site isn’t allowing a cross origin request to it. You would need to have box set this up, or you would have to store these files in HubSpot. Another option would be to use an external server, basically the box domain is preventing requests coming from another webpage. you need to start these from a cloud server. This is the way the web is setup for security purposes
is it the default salesforce app? It doesn’t use an api key

Ended up figuring this out, was a super easy solution, not sure how I didn't run into it sooner. All that was needed was to append .options to the api_response, and it gave me the array of options. From there I could drill down further if needed, api_response.options[0].value would give the 'value' parameter of the first dropdown option.
oh very nice
great work!
Hi Carter
how to mention persona in parameter which has 2 values
I dont the format/syntax
is it a dropdown, radio or checkbox?
normally you just want to pass in the internal value as a string
dropdown
"hs_persona": ["persona_1","persona_2"]
so like this : "hs_persona":"persona_1,persona_2"
comma separated
thanks, appreciate the info on map, that's a cool function
if it's a dropdown you can only select 1 thing, but if it's a checkbox you can select multiple
100% use it all the time super helpful
cool
let me try

Very helpful <@U25PYL3Q8>, thank you. I don't have quite enough experience to connect the dots appropriately--untill your orientig me in the right direction. I gather we _can_ add additional  items to the header of our CMS but not that modify or conflict with  underlying policy? E.g., I was able to add on  ```<script src="<https://documentservices.adobe.com/view-sdk/viewer.js|https://documentservices.adobe.com/view-sdk/viewer.js>"></script>``` to <Header> at a page level.
I think there is an error
can you see scenario
its a dropdwon
there ar e 2 apis... and select each value in every api
i think I have made mistake in syntax
Dropdowns can only have one value so you just need to choose one of them
okay
in double quotes?
Yep that's totally good
wow..worked man
thank you buddy
god bless
:heart::+1:
God bless you as well

So there are two headers — one that exists inside the html document — this is where your meta data goes, and typically scripts and stylesheets. This is where you would add your viewer.js file (these could also be loaded in the footer or elsewhere on the page, but not important to this discussion)

The second header is more about the <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers|HTTP Headers> on a page. These have request and response headers as well as a whole bunch of other items. These aren’t managed inside HubSpot and are more like “server” items vs webpage items. HubSpot locks most of this down unless you have CMS Enterprise, then you have some options, but overall companies like HubSpot and other platforms. (google drive, box, etc), you don’t have access to these items. They keep their security tight.

I hope that makes a bit more sense. That being said, if you are looking at getting those box files over to your HubSpot account, I’d look to see if zapier will get them copied over, or some other integration, or you would need some custom code to make that work, using a off site server to access this data.

Hey guys! My partner and I are having trouble with the github deployment to HubSpot, this is the error that is being thrown. We have tried the solution suggested on line 30 and it did not work. We think that it might have something to do with the HubSpot API Key? Maybe we need to regenerate one or something? We are not sure on what to do, and we do not have access to manage the API key, so any help would be much appreciated. Thanks!
You added your own personal access token?
the thing is the github workflow was changed by someone who doesn't work for the company anymore, and after he left it started to throw this error so we are kinda clueless on what to do
do you think that we would have to update these two secrets in our /github/workflows yml files?
you'll just need to update the HubSpot personal access key
the portal id will be the same
I think you probably removed his HubSpot account, and so it would break this workflow
ohhh ok that makes sense, so the HubSpot personal key that was used was his?
yes it's "personal" to him
ok so if i were to use anyones key who is on our HubSpot website team, it would work and not change any existing repos or override anything?
correct
awesome thank you so much!!! :pray:

Hi there, I am testing the Imports API for use in an integration. The integration needs to create and update contacts as well as custom objects (and the associations between those records) from a single .csv file. Everything works as I expect when the import is run manually/through the regular UI in HubSpot. But when I attempt the exact same steps with the Imports API, I am seeing different behavior and errors.

My test is broken into two steps:
*Step 1:* Run an import with a single row of data representing multiple associated objects. The row contains a contact record and two custom objects (Policy and Party). This is the entire .csv file:
```email, policy_id, party_id
<mailto:dave@fakemail.com|dave@fakemail.com>, 123, 456 ```
*Step 2:* Run another import with a second single row of data that is identical to the first, except that the email address for the contact is different:
```email, policy_id, party_id
<mailto:erik@fakemail.com|erik@fakemail.com>, 123, 456```
The expected outcome is that the Policy with ID 123 will be updated to have a new associated contact (<mailto:erik@fakemail.com|erik@fakemail.com>) instead of <mailto:dave@fakemail.com|dave@fakemail.com>, and the same should happen for the Party with ID 456. This is exactly what happens when I run two subsequent Imports through the regular Import UI/feature of HubSpot.

When I attempt this through the Imports API, however, I get an error on the second import attempt, and nothing gets updated (the Policy and Party objects do not get assigned a new associated contact). The error says "Duplicate Unique Property Value". Is there some additional field/flag I need to add in my importRequest object that gets sent when initiating the import via the API? Thank you!

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YGWHDKQ/p1677558897605109>
can you share you're import request?
just another thing to keep in mind when using that api the order of the columns matter unlike in the UI, that's usually what trips up people. Doesn't look like you have this problem though

Yes Nicholas , it is default salesforce app.
But the timestamps of API calls matches with contact updates. that is why we thought salesforce app making the api calls.

Thanks for your reply!

If I'm using a private app and thus don't have an API key, do I need to use a token that has an expiration date?

My "app" is a contact form on our website that should transfer the incoming contacts to HubSpot via API.

Does this "app" need to refresh the token on its own?

Could it be the wrong approach to use the API for transferring contact requests from our website to HubSpot?

Best regards,
René
